member.name: T:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.DefineAttributeDataExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods to set attribute values using a data file.

member.name: M:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.DefineAttributeDataExtensions.DefineAttributeData(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,AD.IO.DelimitedFilePath)
member.summary: Defines attributes on the root and descendants using a data file.
member.param: A with headers and double values.
member.returns: A reference to the existing . This is returned for use with fluent syntax calls.

member.name: M:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.DefineAttributeDataExtensions.DefineAttributeData(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,AD.IO.DelimitedFilePath,System.Int32)
member.summary: Defines attributes on the element using a data file.
member.param: The element to which attributes are added.
A with headers and double values.
The row index of the data (where the header row == -1) for this element.
member.returns: A reference to the existing . This is returned for use with fluent syntax calls.

member.name: T:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.PriceExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods to calculate prices for markets described by XML trees.

member.name: M:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.PriceExtensions.CalculatePriceIndex(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Returns the calculated price of the node by aggregating the initial prices of itself or any sub-markets. Result = [Î£ marketShare[i] * (price[i] ^ (1 - elasticityOfSubstitution[i])] ^ [1 / (1 - elasticityOfSubstitution)]

member.name: T:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.ShockPriceExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods to appy tariff shocks to initial prices.

member.name: M:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.ShockPriceExtensions.ShockPrice(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Sets the ShockedPrice attribute = initialPrice * (1 + tariff)
member.returns: A reference to the existing . This is returned for use with fluent syntax calls.

member.name: M:AD.PartialEquilibriumApi.ShockPriceExtensions.ShockAllPrices(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Sets each ShockedPrice attribute in reverse document order = initialPrice * (1 + tariff)
member.returns: A reference to the existing . This is returned for use with fluent syntax calls.
